Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Remote Ischaemic Preconditioning in Pancreatic Surgery

Participants.evidence: adult patients scheduled for elective pancreatic surgery at St. Antonius Hospital, Nieuwegein, Netherlands

Intervention.evidence: randomised to RIPC or a sham procedure

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the effect of remote ischaemic preconditioning (RIPC) on perioperative high-sensitive cardiac troponin T (hs-cTnT) and interleukin 6 (IL-6) concentrations.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the maximum postoperative hs-cTnT concentration within 48 hours.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a web-based system with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: both patients and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: Ninety-two patients were randomised (46 RIPC, 46 control)

Number_Analysed.evidence: 90 were analysed using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: RIPC did not significantly reduce the maximum hs-cTnT concentration (12.6 ng/l RIPC, 16.6 ng/l controls, P = 0.225)

Harms.evidence: No RIPC-related adverse events were reported.

Funding.evidence: Biomarker analysis was funded by Roche Diagnostics, which had no role in the study design, conduct, or manuscript preparation.
